original_title: SJB to lay down conditions to support domestic debt restructuring: Harsha
original_body_lines: The main opposition Samagi Jana Balawegaya ( SJB) will not support domestic debt restructuring program which is to be presented to Parliament on July 1 if certain conditions are not met.

“We will not support the domestic debt restructuring programme if the government goes ahead with a debt haircut which is more or less writing off debts. We also stress that the depositors should be safeguarded. We have already said the government should not lay its hands on the EPF and ETF. We will support it only if the government agrees to the line which we have drawn up,” Dr. de Silva told a media briefing.

At the same time he said the Opposition had heard of plan by the government to present the domestic debt restructuring plan to the Cabinet on June 28, refer it to the Public Finance Committee on June 29 and then get it approved by Parliament on Saturday.
“President Ranil Wickremesinghe talked to me and the Opposition Leader on this matter over the phone,” he said but fell short of divulging the details on phone conversation.
He further said all opposition parties will meet tomorrow to discuss the developments.(Yohan Perera)
